1.13.20  11:49 am   I have been doing keyboard for 7 years now but I'm still a beginner. Part of the reason is I keep quitting after a while like I'll do it for a year then leave it for two. Part of the reason is that I have short fingers and it's hard to reach all the keys. But I really like doing keyboard. So what should I do ? Should I quit? But I like making songs... so as you saw I'm kind of at war with myself so I'm here asking you for advice... plz help

     what exactly would be the down side of keeping doing it? from your description, it sounds like none. you did not mention any down side to doing that

1.13.20  9:49 am   How do you feel about answering people's personal questions, such as those about personal relationships or issues at work or school? Do you see these questions as equal to the ones about your work or those about music in general, or do you prefer one over the other? 

     the most important thing about this questions page is i do not decide what questions people ask. the more someone else decides the question, the more i get to decide the answer

1.13.20  1:50 am   How do you balance? Lately I've been practicing not falling and would appreciate some advice. Thanks :)

     some type of side to side alternation would be necessary, which can be steadied. motion is unavoidable in this universe, universe is filled with motion, based on motion; you'll never stop the motion. your best/only option is to guide it into an evenly balanced pattern

1.13.20  1:42 am   I think - I think - it is somehow very useful, and maybe even essential, for a fine artist to have to somehow make his peace on the canvas with all the things he /cannot/ do. That is what attracts us to serious paintings, I think: that shortfall, which we might call "personality," or maybe even "pain."

     that's true. then it's also a balance between that and learning new things. i like to go back and forth between learning new things, and then admitting how much i still can't do, etc

1.13.20  1:24 am   should i live more in the moment or the present?

     half and half

1.13.20  1:00 am   Hi Bill just checking in, how are you doing, both physically and mentally?

     i am pretty much a spring breeze

     0

1.12.20  11:37 pm   can1.12.20  3:13 pm     can i have them?

     many of them should show up in the reality section quite soon

1.12.20  11:30 pm   1.9.20  5:57 pm   i don't understand your answer here at all and it's bothering me. would you mind ruining the joke by explaining this whole leg room situation?

     if someone says 'waffles or pancakes', and nothing else, that is only a fragment of a question. they would need to say 'what' they are asking whether is pancakes or waffles. like if they showed me an item, and then said 'pancakes or waffles', then i would assumedly try to decide whether that item seems to be pancakes or waffles. Or, if they played me an audio sound, and then said 'pancakes or waffles', i would presumably be supposed to figure out if the sound is pancakes or waffles. When they say "pancakes or waffles", with absolutely no context, it presents a mostly impossible situation for me. so, given that the context is totally missing, sometimes rather than let the question hang frozen in contextlessness, i might make up my own context entirely, because they gave me absolutely nothing. so in this case, i made up the context as if the person was wondering which offered more leg room, pancakes or waffles, and also i made up the fact that the persons legs are quite small. so, in that way, i treated the horrible emptiness like a blank canvas. and i take blank canvases very seriously

1.12.20  11:14 pm   who is randy,

     not a person. it's a feeling

      and why am i able to feel him?

     not a him, it's a feeling

      what is randy's occupation? is randy an experiment or a living being in touch with his emotions? 

     a feeling, that you may or may not have. it's the feeling of being excited to view the questions in a randomly selected manner

1.12.20  10:48 pm   i like deliberately including one mistake. that way people remember someone MADE this. if it were perfect, everyone would just take it for granted, y'know?

     actually i think the issue gets even more severe than that. every particle that differs from another can be considered a mistake. the only thing perfect is purely blank. which most people do not prefer
